â€‰ I haven't tried this moisturizer but I always feared shea butter and coconut oil as someone who has oily sensitive combo skin prone to acne. I have been using La Roche Posay Cicaplast Baume B5 as a night cream for a couple of weeks now to repair my skin barrier and my skin loves it even though it's rich. It was only last week that I discovered my dreaded shea butter is in it. I wonder what other wonderful products I skipped because of one suboptimal ingredient. Point is, perhaps I would try it regardless, maybe the formula appeals to your skin.

â€‰ I damaged my skin barrier around my eyes and have cut out all acids and pared my routine down to the basics as I heal. Basically just water cleansing, SkinFix Barrier+ Triple Lipid Peptide Cream, La Roche Posay Cicaplast Balm, and an occlusive at night. My skin feels great after my routine but halfway through the day my undereyes are feeling stingy, tight and irritated again. I want to introduce a veryyyy gentle serum soon but so many barrier repair serums look great until I see AHA or Lactic acid in the ingredient list. The best ingredient list I've seen so far for a serum like this is Experiment Super Saturated but it's a little bit pricey and I'm trying not to overspend after I splurged on the SkinFix. But it's working wonders compared to Vanicream. I was intrigued by the Cocokind one but there's lactic acid so idk. I would like something with glycerin vs just hyaluronic acid, I feel like it's not very hydrating for me. I think I'm okay with niacinamide. But I just really don't want to risk any sort of exfoliant right now, I just need a bit more extra moisture to last throughout the day. I love Asian skincare but if possible I'd prefer something I can get at Ulta, Sephora, or the drugstore because my skin doesn't have months to wait lol. Some AB products on Amazon are legit so if you can vouch for them I'll try it!! The SoonJung moisturizer on Amazon seems no different than when I order it on YesStyle but some people have horror stories about ordering products on Amazon. Thank you :)

â€‰ I'm almost finished with my first HaruHaru Wonder sunscreen (Airyfit) and I love it. I have tried everything from La Roche Posay, Elta MD (one of my favs though pricey), multiple Supergoop (no longer purchase this brand, see lawsuit), Neutrogena, Elf, Bum (something or other), Beauty of Joseon and more. So far my recent favorite is the HaruHaru Wonder Airyfit. I sadly purchased from Amazon so was extremely concerned I may have purchased a fake, I decided to do an all day wear test at the beach the other week. I used four different sunscreens (1 on each bottom half wrist/arm, left a gap in the middle for reference, 1 on each top part of my forearm). I used Elta MD Daily Tinted, Neutrogena Sport spf 70 (happened to have though don't really use), HaruHaru Wonder Airyfit and leftover Supergoop Play. It seems HaruHaru was in the lead with Elta MD, for being the lightest part(s) of the tested areas. Of course this is not a scientific test, though a visual to give me some idea as to how well they actually protect me. Hope this helps!

â€‰ of course!! morning: wash for 60 seconds with la roche posay toleriane purifying cleanser (what i've used for years and love) spray with hypochlorous acid spray (i've used the cheap one from amazon and it's fine! i also use the tower 28 and prefer that one as it doesn't make my skin feel as dry) then go in with byoma hydrating milky toner (never had any issues applying this over a breakout) then tower 28 SOS serum then tower 28 moisturizerâ€” game changer and absolutely obsessed with this product. it's the only moisturizer that never stings or makes my skin feel bad. 100000% recommend. at night: if i'm wearing makeup/sunscreen (which is most days tbh) use the juno skin cleansing balm, rub in intensely, add a tiny bit of water and massage into skin more, then rinse. followed by washing with la roche posay toleriane purifying cleanser, making sure i'm washing for 60 seconds!!! i swear my skin has only improved since i've posted this and that's the only change i've made recently. now that my skin is better i apply my tretinoin to my forehead and cheeks but i skipped this for about 3ish months and just went straight intoâ€¦ moisturize with tower 28 moisturizer if my skin is super dry (which it tends to get dry in patches with the PD breakout), i apply some aquaphor to those patches before bed. i also always take a midday shower because i have to gym before work and in that shower i- rinse with just water spray hypochlorous spray moisturize with the tower 28 moisturizer if you couldn't tell i'm a super fan of the tower 28 stuff ğŸ˜… but i was using other products before and they all irritated it and made my PD worse i felt so i took a risk and tried it and now i don't think ill ever go back!

â€‰ Of course!! Made me so happy to see so figured I'd share it here â˜º Yes! A few of my absolute favorites that I would definitely repurchase are the sun bum detox hair scalp mask (already repurchased about 3 times past 2 years), hempz lotion- sooo hydrating and smells amazing plus leaves a really pretty glow, the lume deodorant which I just got more of from amazon prime day, the La Roche Posay triple moisturizer, tree hut sugar srubs, thrive causemetics tubing mascara (the best!!!) , pixi exfoliating pads, and the Eva-nyc hair mask which I've purchased several times (they did recently change formula, make the containers smaller, AND raise price though). Also really enjoyed all of my Glow Recipe skin care and the oribe hair shampoo and conditioner samples, although the full sizes are a bit pricy so not 100% sure if I would buy!

â€‰ Thank you for sharing your holy grail routine, it is nice to see some different products, rather that La Roche Posay - which I had never used in the past, and might be bomb, but I so love Korean made stuff so. I've been looking heavily into barrier repair creams, and redness sooting creams with ingridients like ceramides and centalla to use with tret. I wonder if they will suffice. I am yet to give a try, I had only used retinol 1% thus far, but seeing all these amazing anti-aging before and after pics makes me think was I under a rock or something. Anyway, why did you start using tret? I am asking because frankly I am scared of any potential purging process, I started using retinol for acne, and I cannot recall purging but rather a gradual acne relief over time, but I do get a pimple here and there, so I don't know what might come out, and my second concern is to make sure I moisturize it well. Also, I've heard that other products(need to see my screen shots for names) help bring the best of tret, in other words if you aint using it with so and so, you are not using it to its full potential. Anybody who has experience please do share.

â€‰ Hi!! I am just past cycle 4/6 on TC with paxman cold capping. I am very impressed with my results so far. I have fairly thin hair so I think that has helped. I ordered the Simple brand gentle shampoo and conditioner paxman suggested on their website (found it on Amazon). Only wash my hair twice a week. After washing I use the DermaE biotin thickening spray (used this prior to diagnosis, really convinced it has helped) and also use the Verb leave in conditioner as well to help with moisture (again something I used prior) As for skin, I switched to from CeraVe foaming facial cleanser to the oil based cleanser to help with dryness. I use the Beekman milkshake toner and then CeraVe moisturizer for days and Dear Klairs midnight calming cream at night(recommended here or another page) and it has REALLY helped keep my skin balanced and moist. My nurse also gave me a sample of the La Roche Posay Cicaplast Balm and I used it when I had a chemo rash on my cheeks and it really helped! Can't offer advice on mouth sores and I haven't gotten any. My nurse suggested taking L-Lysine supplement twice daily to help prevent them and apparently it's working haha. Good luck to you on this journey!!!

â€‰ Everything on this list is less than $25 â€” which is the going rate for an arm and leg these days. 1. AÂ Some by Mi Miracle toner, which is one of the most popular exfoliating treatments in the K-beauty game. This features a blend of chemical exfoliants, which sounds kind of scary but is actually super effective for gently sloughing away dead skin cells and clearing out excess oil. There's also some tea tree oil to help reduce the appearance of breakouts, so this is basically a reset button for congested skin. After cleansing, soak your cotton pad with the toner, gently wipe your face, and lightly tap for absorption. Follow with moisturizer! Read more about tea tree oil and acne at Mayo Clinic. Promising review: "I have pretty bad eczema and sensitive skin, so I was a little worried about it, but this was probably one of the best decisions I've made in a long time. I've been using this toner for over a month now. I use it twice a day. My face has improved 110%. It removed dirt even after washing my face and I haven't had any serious breakouts or skin bumps since. I have more confidence in my natural face and am loving it! I would definitely recommend trying this out and seeing if it's right for you. 10/10 would buy again." â€”MintyKiss Get it from Amazon for $15.80Â (also available as a two-pack). 2. Bio-Collagen's Real Deep sheet maskÂ that works overnight to refresh your skin. No, really, it's designed to be worn while you sleep â€” it's transfer-resistant, so it won't leave a mess on your pillow! It's infused with hyaluronic acid to hydrate, collagen to maximize absorption and minimize the appearance of pores, and probiotics to strengthen the skin's barrier. Best of all, it turns transparent when your skin is done absorbing the serum, so you'll know when it's ready to take off. Most reviewers recommend doing this treatment once per week. Promising review: "Caught wind of this on TikTok and decided to give it a whirl. Honestly, it's pretty solid! It really makes my skin look tight and shiny, like I just came out of a professional facial. It's an overnight mask, so yeah, it does have to stay on for a while, which is a bit of a hassle, but the payoff? Totally worth it. My skin feels more elastic, and the pores look minimized, too. If you don't mind the long wear time, this mask could be a game changer for your skincare routine!" â€”Nala Get a set of four from Amazon for $19Â (available in three formulas and a pack of 16). 3. Cerave's Resurfacing Retinol Serum â€” a super gentle and beginner-friendly way to finally add retinol to your skincare routine. What does retinol do? The work is mysterious and important. Just kidding, it's not mysterious at all: retinol helps speed up your skin's cell turnover process, which will help reveal plumper, smoother-looking skin while refining your pores and fading dark spots. Also, dermatologists are obsessed with it. I love this stuff so much I once wrote an ode to it â€” read it here! But PLEASE do not use this every night if this is your first time using retinol â€” start slowly with just a couple of nights a week, and then increase once you feel your skin is adjusted. And if you wear it during the day, be sure to apply SPF as well! Promising review: "I'm finally giving this a review after using up my first bottle, and I actually reordered my second one. That's how much I like it. I have sensitive skin, and I hate the feeling of residual residue on my skin, especially on my face, after applying anything (hence why I rarely wear makeup). I'm in my early forties and noticed that I've been getting sun spots (which I like to think are "freckles") on my checks which were never there before.... One pump goes a long way and covers the entire face and under my chin area. Very light feel on the skin and absorbs fairly fast...I like the results that it's giving me. My face looks more even, toned, and moisturized, and my pores seem to have diminished a little in appearance since I first used it. I don't get little dry patches on the skin on my checks anymore due to the harsh water here in Houston, TX. Again, it's really based on your skin routine, how consistent you are, how well you follow its instructions, and be realistic with your expectations....

â€‰ Ever wanted to glean some fashion advice from a styling expert? Do you wonder about what is on trend and how to make your outfits really work? Celebrity stylist and fashion journalist Laura Mullett has got you covered! From working with celebrities at magazine shoots to hosting fashion segments on RTE's Today show, she knows her stuff when it comes to everything sartorial. Here, we catch up with Laura to chat about all things fashion and style. Her favourite item in her wardrobe is a black cashmere blend thin jumper from Intimissimi. "It's the perfect top for day to night and it's so soft, flattering and comfy." Where does she buy her fabulous fits? "I love pottering in charity shops like Oxfam, Vision Ireland and St Vincent's. I also love vintage stores, especially Jenny Vander. I buy cute seasonal staples from Very Ireland â€“ they're perfect for some dopamine dressing. I love ChloBo Jewellery too. I adore candle shopping in TK Maxx as well, it's free aromatherapy!" Any fashion crimes she's committed? "As a child I poured Lucozade down my Communion dress because I thought it would look better pink. Nowadays, I like to experiment with fashion and wear things that are bright, funky and positive. In terms of crimes I can probably look like a walking highlighter at times. But I think being playful in your sense of style means you can have fun." She loves the fact that the early 2000s trends are coming full circle. "I feel like interpreting trends in your own way is what makes fashion so exciting and you really don't have to spend to look good â€“ circular fashion, repurposing and upcycling has never been more stylish." With regards to her style crush, she loved Sydney Sweeney at fashion week and on the red carpet for awards season. "She is such a bombshell and wears a lot of Miu Miu. Schiaparelli is my favourite design house. I'm so fascinated by their pieces, they're pure art." Her golden fashion rule is dressing for your shape. "It is essential. Opt for a fit that looks best on you, don't go by sizing labels. Instinctively go for what makes you feel beautiful and what you enjoy wearing. That famous Emma Thompson quote resonates with me: 'Don't waste your life's purpose worrying about your body. This is your vessel, it's your house. It's where you live â€“ there's no point in judging it'." Her handbag essentials include her Kindle, headphones and usually a coffee cup flask. "I love my skincare. I use Ella & Jo SPF, La Roche Posay Cicaplast, Biofresh Vitamin C, the Skin Formulas peptide lip treatment and their face mist. Dr. Jart+ Cicapair is amazing for redness. Aesop mini deodorant is pricey but it's natural and lasts so long." The most expensive item in her wardrobe are her wedding shoes. "My wedding shoes, they're Jimmy Choo and I cherish them. I've actually worn them a few times to events and red carpets. Ironically, I found a pair of black patent Jimmy Choo peep toes in my size in my local charity shop for â‚¬30. So that kind of balances the whole wedding shoes investment!" How about the most stylish place she's visited? "I did some fashion buying for a brand in Florence and Milan and I loved it. In terms of street style, probably Paris. The locals dress so chic and understated and the tourists are more eclectic." This article originally appeared in the May issue of RSVP.

â€‰ The cream is part of Boots' popular No7 range Boots is a treasure trove of skincare products, but with thousands to choose from, it can be difficult for consumers to know what to pick. Beauty fans on the search for anti-ageing creams have been praising a well-regarded No7 cream for its effective results. The is Â£37.95 and contains SPF 40, so there is no need to apply a sunscreen on top. It is made with a blend of beneficial peptides and also contains hyaluronic acid, vitamin C, and niacinamide. No7 says the day cream is 'proven to protect against UV' as well as 'reverse visible signs of skin damage'. The is also dermatologist-approved. The moisturiser has more than 1,300 customer reviews. A Boots buyer said: "Just a lovely moisturiser that hydrates my skin, minimises my wrinkles, and goes super with my Boots foundation. It's the perfect combination." Elsewhere, contains 10% pure vitamin C and can be bought from LookFantastic for Â£29. It's made with an ingredient called 'l-ascorbic acid' that CeraVe says 'addresses the first visible signs of ageing'. Another option is Elemis' Pro-Collagen Marine Cream, which contains SPF 30 and can be bought from Amazon for Â£95. The cream promises to smooth skin, as well as significantly reduce the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles in 14 days of consecutive use. No7 Future Renew Day Cream SPF40 It is 'expertly developed' to target and prevent visible signs of skin damag Â£37.95 Boots Reviewing the No7 , another shopper added: "The cream feels really nice on my skin, I think my skin looks plumper and healthy." Not all buyers were pleased, with one reporting issues with the consistency of the product. They said: "Too greasy for day use takes ages to absorb in the morning and difficult to add foundation, much prefer La Roche Posay SPF 50, non-greasy and able to add makeup soon after. Will continue to use night cream and serum but not day cream." An additional shopper said: "Really lovely day cream with a good level of SPF that helps look after your skin, whilst reducing your wrinkles. Really good value for a quality product." Another added: "My skin looks amazing and wrinkles are less visible."

â€‰ This thread is like waaay old but for everyone asking about a specific brand of HA, you just want something that isn't thick and has a lower molecular weight. You don't need one that has anything extra in it. Especially if you're not using it for anything other than hydration. IF you do want anything extra get something with B5(panthenol) It helps attract and retain moisture but isn't totally necessary. Some examples are Torriden Dive-in, isntree ultra low molecular HA serum, The ordinary HA 2%+B5, La Roche Posay b5 (most expensive out of the 4) I use Torriden every day twice a day on my face. Not to treat psoriasis, just to keep my skin hydrated. I was clearly looking for a solution like everyone else haha. I'd recommend getting a Korean brand, the first 2 on the list are. One thing that is worth mentioning is that HA is typically recommended to use on damp skin (not wet) or else it can draw out moisture. So maybe use it after the shower OR spray hypochlorous acid before the serum to get some moisture. That spray is like a cure all for skin irritation istg. A big bottle is like $11 or something on Amazon. Anyways, I'm going to try this! Thanks for the tip!! :)
